> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/19994?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [024d8b4...f62dd67](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/19994?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

I think the only cases are when the function/method does not return anything (I would about a return None), when a class it's being documented, or when the function yields its value.

If I'm not wrong, it should be easy in Python to detect whether it's a class or a generator yielding the values. But not sure if there is an easy way to detect that a function doean't have a return, or all returns return None

> I think the only cases are when the function/method does not return anything (I would about a return None), when a class it's being documented, or when the function yields its value.

I don't think we have many functions/methods in pandas that do not return anything (except for the inplace ones, but that is always an option)
